entry.title: New release for Open Streaming Platform: 0.9.8
entry.content:
• OSP-Core: Adds Subscription Count to Channel API
  • OSP-Core: Adds Lazy Load to Channel and Admin Settings Stickers, Chat Sticker Picker
  • OSP-Core: Optimizes page load for My Channels Settings Page
  • OSP-Core: Fixes Bug in Channels Search API
  • OSP-Core: Optimization of the List User API Call
  • OSP-Core: Various Bug Fixes related to calls to non-existent values

entry.title: New release for Open Streaming Platform: 0.9.9
entry.content:
• OSP-Core: Fixes for Channel Level Webhooks Not Displaying
  • OSP-Core: Optimizations on Channel Level Webhooks
  • OSP-Core: Fixes to the /user endpoint which causes 500 error on pulling users with channels
  • OSP-Core: Added Ability for Admins to Transfer a Channel to Another User
  • OSP-Core: Adds Ability for Admins to Force Reset a User Password
  • OSP-Core: Optimized /video API routes on all videos and individual video
  • OSP-Core: Optmized Updating of Channel Chat Settings
  • OSP-Core: Fixes a bug where video comments > 2048 characters would cause a 500 error
  • OSP-Core/Ejabberd: Removed the requirement for configuring external Ejabberd access. OSP will now act as a reverse proxy to Ejabberd's BOSH connection

entry.title: New release for Open Streaming Platform: 0.9.10
entry.content:
• OSP: Added Beta Support for OSP-Hub (hub.openstreamingplatform.com)
  • OSP: OSP-Core, OSP-RTMP, and OSP-Proxy Python Dependencies have been moved to VirtualEnvironment. Will be migrated on upgrades
  • OSP-Core: Improvement and Fixes to Video Clipping !388
  • OSP-Core: Updated RTMP Ingest Labels !386
  • OSP-Core: Truncates Video Comments > 2048 Characters
  • OSP-Core: Fixes to Chat Popout Window
  • OSP-Core: Fixes for HTML returns on Deleted Users
  • OSP-Core: Adds User Notification on Video Processing Start and Completion
  • OSP-Core: Fixes a possible JS xss vulnerability in the chat and profile system.
  • OSP-Core: Formatting Change on Sort By Button
  • OSP-Installer: Added check to ensure required SMTP values are present
  • OSP-Installer: Moves Default Nginx Install to 1.22.1
  • OSP-Installer: Moves Default Ejabberd Install to 23.04
  • OSP-Installer: Moves Default ZLib Install to 1.3

entry.title: New release for Open Streaming Platform: 0.9.11
entry.content:
BREAKING CHANGE : Ejabberd's Internal Domain has been moved to osp.internal to elminate install complexity.
Previous installs will need to edit the /opt/ejabberd/conf/ejabberd.yml to swap your domain to osp.internal. Another option is to add ospXMPPDomain to your /opt/osp/conf/config.py and set the value to the name of your OSP Ejabberd domain name See: https://open-streaming-platform.readthedocs.io/en/latest/install/upgrades.html#chat-upgrade - OSP-Core: Improvements to Admin Page UI - MR !399 (@Helix9618) - OSP-Core: Configurable maximum size (MiB) for Sticker uploads. !397 (@Helix9618) - OSP-Core: Configurable maximum sizes (MiB) for video upload and thumbnail upload !395 (@Helix9618) - OSP-Core: Improvements to 'Stream Key', 'RTMP Ingest', and 'XMPP Token' fields for channel settings. !396 (@Helix9618) - OSP-Core: Bumps VideoJs version to 8.9.0 - OSP-Core: Adds ospXMPPDomain as an option in the config.py - OSP-Core: Adds ability for users to change username - Ejabberd: Sets the default XMPP domain to osp.internal
